In the heart of Tianhai City…

At the center of the business district stood a fifty-story skyscraper. A large nameplate gleamed under the sunlight: Wang Investment. It was not only the core of the Wang family’s financial empire but also one of the most powerful investment firms in the entire city.

Now, panic gripped the company.

Their stock was plummeting rapidly, already down 30%.
On the top floor, in the president’s office, a man sat smoking one cigarette after another.
His mind was racing, thoughts spinning like a tornado.

“Who is it?”
“Who’s taking action against Wang Investment?”
“Is this just about the company… or is someone targeting the entire Wang family?”

Suddenly, a stunning woman entered the room without knocking.

The man looked at her with irritation.
On any other day, he might have welcomed the distraction. After all, she was not just his secretary but also his pleasure companion.
But not today.

Today was a battlefield.

“President Wang, there’s bad news.”

This man was Wang Chen—the current president of Wang Investment and the father of Wang Wei.

“What is it?”

“Hong Corp is buying our shares aggressively. Their equity has already reached nearly 18%.”

“Impossible. They don’t have that kind of liquidity.”

“It’s true, President.”

After a pause, Wang Chen exhaled slowly.
“…Alright. You may go.”

As the door closed behind her, his face grew darker.

Who is it? It should not be the Hong family. Although the Hong family has been in the limelight recently, they do not have the capability to do this. Do not say the current Hong family, even if they are two times powerful, they can't create this problem for the Wang Investment. Is somebody or some other power using the Hong family as a front?

He picked up his phone and made a call.

The person on the other side answered immediately.

“Hmm, I’ve heard that from the outside, it looks like the Hong family is behind this. But there’s a shadow; other forces are involved.”

“Where did they get the money?”

There was a pause on the other end of the call.
Then came the reply:

“It’s the Eastern Bank.”

It felt like a bomb had gone off in Wang Chen’s chest.
Things had just become far more serious.

The Eastern Bank?

One of the most powerful financial institutions in the world.
One of the feared Thirty-Three.

How did they get involved?

The voice on the other end continued,
“I’ve heard that the Rong family, the Bai family, and a few other business and underworld factions went to the Eastern Bank’s Tianhai branch, together with the Hong family. They convinced the branch manager to approve a large loan. And it worked.”

“Why didn’t we know about this earlier?”

“That’s on us. I caught wind of something, but I didn’t realize the situation was this critical.”

“We can’t do anything directly right now. Can you stop the money flow?”

“I might be able to. But it’ll be dangerous, far riskier than what we’re facing now.”

“Fine. I’m calling Dad. Maybe we can ask the Xiao family for help.”

“Alright. But be careful. Don’t push too hard, you know why.”

“Yes.”

Although the Hong family held a clear advantage for now, there was a limit.

If a company were attacked too aggressively and its share price dropped, especially without clear regulatory violations and reason, higher government institutions might step in to stabilize the economic system. They will also punish some undisciplined parties for the market instability.

But for Wang Chen, this wasn’t just business, it was personal.
His pride was on the line. He had to act.

The person on the other end of the line was Wang Zhi, Wang Chen’s brother.
He was the head of the Financial and Banking Regulation Commission of Tianhai, a powerful and influential person.

Just after he ended the call with Wang Chen, his phone rang again.
Wang Zhi answered, and after hearing what was said from the opposite side, his expression instantly changed.

Meanwhile, Wang Chen made another call, this time to his father, the head of the Wang family.

They needed to act fast.

The Xiao Family — the most powerful family in Tianhai.

The Xiao family estate is located on the eastern side of Tianhai. It spans several vast traditional villas, complete with horse fields, golf courses, and every luxury one could imagine. Anyone who enters this place can immediately feel the power, influence, and deep-rooted tradition of the people who live here.

In the middle villa, in a quiet meeting room, several people sat drinking tea.
Tension lingered under the calm surface.

Then the man in the center of the room spoke:

“What is your opinion on the Wang family situation? We need to decide within ten minutes.”

chapters.name: 22. The Decision and Thirty Three
chapters.content:
The strange thing was that nobody spoke for almost a full minute.
After that, when the silence became unbearable, the eldest son finally broke it.

“Dad, I think we should help the Wang family. They’re an old and established clan, while the Hong family is relatively new. If the Hong family's rise is too rapid, it might destabilize the current balance. We don’t know how much impact that could have. Also, if we assist the Wang family now, they may become more inclined toward us.

The other families, like the Rong and Bai, are making too much noise. They didn’t inform us before taking action, and we don’t know what kind of transactions they’re involved in. I think we should crush their plans.”

The head of the Xiao family, seated in the main chair, turned to look at his other two sons.
The middle child spoke next.

“Father, I oppose taking any action. It’s too dangerous. We don’t have the full picture. Just because those family heads went to the Eastern Bank doesn’t mean the bank will lend them money. There could be other factors, other forces, or parties involved.

We shouldn’t blindly step into a situation where a member of the Order of Thirty-Three is involved.”

Then the youngest son spoke.
“Yes, Father, I don’t want us to get involved in this either. We don’t know what we’d be stepping into. Furthermore, I’ve heard there are other movements against the Wang family. That means another influence is surely involved.”

The head of the Xiao family looked at his youngest son with a mixture of scrutiny and admiration.
It was impressive that he knew there were other actions being taken against the Wang family, the information that Xiao family’s own networks hadn’t reported. A family like the Xiaos was highly structured; a member only knew what he was permitted to know. So the youngest son had clearly learned this from an outside source.

In truth, this was a delicate situation for the Xiao family.
Whether or not to help the Wang family had never been up for a vote among the sons. The decision had already been made. He had only wanted to hear their thoughts.

Then the head said,
“Alright. We won’t help the Wang family. It’s not a life-or-death situation for them. They’ll survive. You may go.”

All three sons replied at once,
“Okay, Dad.”

The head of the Xiao family then left the room and walked into a deeper part of the residence. After some time, he entered his father’s old study. No one was there.
He pressed a concealed button on the wall. A hidden passage opened.
He stepped inside.

At the end of the passage was a lift. He entered, and the lift began to descend. It sank forty feet underground before stopping.
The doors opened to a vast open chamber. Several cabins lined the walls, but in the center, an old man was seated.
Suddenly, the old man opened his eyes.
A terrifying pressure burst forth from him.

The Xiao family head immediately fell to his knees.
He was a Huajin-level cultivator, but even he couldn’t withstand it.

Then the head said with difficulty, “Grandfather, it’s me.”

Yes, this man was the ancestor of the Xiao family. He had reached the peak of the Innate Realm’s middle stage.

“Hmm, I can see that it’s you. So why are you here to disturb me?”

“Respected Grandfather, here is the situation—”

He explained everything: the Wang family’s predicament and the Eastern Bank’s involvement.

Honestly, if it were just the Wang family, there would’ve been no need to come here. But the Eastern Bank was different. It was one of the Thirty-Three. Any issue involving them required extreme caution.

And then, there was the Gu Empire.

After hearing it all, the ancestor remained silent for a while. Then he spoke:
“Alright. You’re right. We should not get involved in this.”

The Xiao family head replied, “Although I know this is the right decision for our family, I still feel somewhat unwilling. We possess such great strength, both openly and in the shadows, yet we’re forced to back off when facing the Thirty-Three.”

He paused, then continued.
“And then there’s the Gu Empire. We don’t know much about what they’re doing. I suspect they’ve been in contact with some of our family core members, especially my youngest son.

How else would he have known so quickly about the other actions being taken against the Wang family?

I mean, what even is this Gu Empire? They’re not listed among the Thirty-Three. Where did they come from?

Once, they might have helped us… but now, it feels like they’re holding us back.

This narrative has been purloined without the author's approval. Report any appearances on Amazon.

If not for the threat they pose, I would’ve focused entirely on entering the Thirty-Three.”

He stopped again, his frustration slipping through. His usual calm was gone; he was venting in front of his grandfather.

The ancestor looked at him with a faint smile, tinged with helplessness.

Then the head continued, “Grandfather, I don’t understand this Gu Empire. How powerful are they, really?

Now they want to completely control our family. Why? We built this family with our own hands, nurtured it through hardships, and they think they can control it just by doing us a few favors.

You know I’ve already reached out to some powers within the Thirty-Three to confront the Gu Empire.

My sons are even working to build marital ties with members of the Thirty-Three.

What do you think?

If we join forces with them, can we resist the Gu Empire?
No matter how powerful they are, surely they can’t be that powerful…”

He paused, then added,
“Furthermore, if you can break through to the late stage of the Innate Realm, if my father can break through to the middle stage, and if I can reach the Innate level, we’ll have much more assurance.”

The ancestor gave him a nonchalant glance and said,
“Don’t talk anymore. Leave.”

The head gave an embarrassed smile and replied,
“Farewell, Grandfather.”

After he left, the ancestor let out a long sigh and pulled out a digital tablet.
It was strange for someone like him to own one, but this tablet was different.
The entire casing was made of gold, gleaming like a priceless artifact.
The screen was of exceptional quality, and engraved on the back was a single number: Thirty-Three.

This was an official device issued by the Thirty-Three.
Very few were ever made. All critical information and orders were delivered through it.

The ancestor powered on the device.
The home screen displayed several buttons. He tapped one.
A list appeared, a list of names:

The Thirty-Three most powerful forces in the world.

Some were known even to ordinary citizens of Country X—
Names like the Zi Family, Han Family, Dongfeng Family, and the Eastern Bank.

Others remained hidden from public knowledge, though they too hailed from Country X:
The Medicine God Sect, the Shenfeng Sect, and the Yang Sect.

In total, seven powers from Country X had made it onto the list:
Three families, three sects, and one bank.

The Xiao family’s ancestor stared at the names and let out another sigh.

People believed the Xiao family was powerful, and it was.
But above them… were the names on this list.

Any force that couldn’t enter this circle would never be truly secure.

These organizations now controlled nearly 50% of the world’s resources.
They influenced governments, commanded military units, manipulated the underworld, and dominated global business.

But their greatest asset was still their supernatural strength.

Take the powers from Country X, for example:
Each of the major sects or families had four to five Innate Realm warriors.

The Zi Family, of course, was a different case.
They had only three Innate cultivators—
But their political, military, and governmental reach made them untouchable.

The ancestor’s thoughts paused.
No… they now had four Innate cultivators.
Although there were still some complications with the newest one.

But that woman, that dangerous woman—
She would surely succeed in fully integrating the new Innate into the Zi family.

Truth be told, very few people could earn the admiration of the Xiao family ancestor.
That woman was one of them.

Thinking of her, the ancestor tapped a button on the tablet.
Several images appeared on the screen.

He gazed at one in particular, a woman.
Stunning. Powerful. Dangerous.

Zi Feng, not just a titan in Country X, but one of the most formidable women in the entire world.
Though only at the Dark Strength level, she manipulated the world like a chessboard.

Then his attention shifted to another woman.
She was the second-in-command of the Shenfeng Sect.
Though her position was technically subordinate, the sect master had been in closed-door cultivation for nearly a year, attempting to break through to the Innate Realm.

So, in practice, she now commanded the entire sect.

While the overall strength of the Shenfeng Sect might still fall short of the Zi Family, they remained one of the most powerful forces in the world. After all, they were part of the Thirty-Three.

He scanned some other images in the list.
Each one belonged to a woman.
Each one is a member of the Thirty-Three.

He narrowed his eyes and exhaled slowly.
“Hmm... women are becoming more and more terrifying.”

chapters.name: 23. The First Crack in the Shield
chapters.content:
In another villa.
This one belonged to the eldest son of the Xiao family.

From the study, the sound of a woman crying and being whipped echoed out.
Then, silence.

Some time later, a young woman in an office uniform stepped out of the room.
Her face was flushed, and her expression was bitter.
She was the secretary of the eldest son, also his current primary pleasure companion.

Then came another sound from the study.
It was the sound of something breaking, perhaps a cup or some accessory.
Angry shouting followed.
And then again, silence.

Inside the room, the eldest son, Xiao Lei, wore a bitter and angry expression.

A few minutes later, his own eldest son, Xiao Rui, entered the study.
Xiao Rui was strikingly handsome, one of the top three young masters of Tianhai Royal University.
A typical Prince Charming: sharp, confident, and magnetic.
He was also the elder brother of Xiao Hao.

“What’s happening, Father? Why are you so angry?” he asked.

Xiao Lei snapped out of his thoughts. He calmed down, then recounted what had happened in the earlier meeting.

Xiao Rui looked puzzled.
“So, Father, why are you so upset? Grandfather deciding not to help the Wang family doesn’t seem worth this much anger.”

Xiao Lei replied coldly,
“That is part of it, yes, but not the main issue.

What angers me is that Dad had already decided not to help the Wang family before the meeting. That entire gathering was just for show.

I gave my opinion first, but he dismissed it, then approved the suggestions of my younger brothers.

That’s not just a disagreement. That was a signal.

A signal for me to be careful.

He thinks I’m growing too influential.

This is a subtle move to suppress me.”

Xiao Rui’s eyes narrowed.
“Are you sure, Dad?”

“Yes,” Xiao Lei said firmly.

“But why would he do that?”

“Because I’ve been swaying too many elders toward cutting ties with that Gu Empire.”

“Hmm... the Gu Empire. They were quiet for a long time, but now they’re making moves toward us.”

Truth be told, the Gu Empire had remained silent for so long that many in the Xiao family believed it had been destroyed or had simply faded away.

But recently, they returned with leverage. A mighty one.

They controlled two of the most powerful Innate Tools of the Xiao family. If they truly wished to, those tools could be taken away from the Xiao family forever.

Xiao Rui frowned.
“Grandfather still isn’t sure about confronting the Gu Empire, is he?”

Xiao Lei shook his head.
“If they really do take control of those tools… the loss would be unimaginable.”

He then looked at his son and added,
“So, here comes your duty. You have to pursue one of those girls and marry her. If you can do that, then your grandfather may also make the decision to confront the Gu Empire.

At that point, we’ll team up with the other Thirty-Three influences and fight back against the Gu Empire.

Otherwise, there’s no chance. Our dream of becoming one of the Thirty-Three will remain just that, a dream.”

“Father, if we stop resisting the Gu Empire, what do you think will become of us? Will we grow stronger?”

“It doesn’t matter. In that case, no matter how powerful we become, someone will always be above us.
And I don’t want that.”

“Okay, Father. I’ll do my best.”

His mind then drifted toward two exceptional women, Bai Yue and Xia Qingyue.
Both had deep connections to the Thirty-Three.

If he could win over either of them, it would not only be a great feat for himself but also for the Xiao family.
It would almost guarantee that he’d become the next head of the family after his father. No one would be able to change that.

OH, only if I can marry both.

There was a trace of saliva on the corner of his mouth.

Tianhai Royal University’s police station.
It was one of the most important in all of Tianhai.

The captain’s post was especially significant. Its importance could be seen from the fact that the position was directly overseen by the provincial police chief, and the captain’s rank was equivalent to that of a deputy city mayor.

There were only four such police stations in the entire Tianhai.

Suddenly, three cars pulled up in front of the station.

Stolen from Royal Road, this story should be reported if encountered on Amazon.
From their setup and license plates, it was clear they were government vehicles.

A group of people stepped out and entered the station.
Some of them showed their IDs and badges.

They came from different departments:

The Provincial Discipline Committee, The Audit Bureau, The Procurement Department, and The Provincial Legal Affairs Committee.

Each quickly took their position inside the building.

Then, four department heads entered the captain’s office.

“Captain Leng, you are hereby suspended.
You must come with us for an official investigation.

There are charges against you, allegations that you have been aiding a criminal gang.
Also, you are suspected of suppressing reports related to multiple sexual misconduct incidents that happened at the Tianhai Royal University.”

Captain Leng felt as if he had fallen from the sky.

He was around forty years old.
Although not related to the Wang family by blood, it was no secret within the inner circles that he was one of their most important pawns.

After the initial surprise, Captain Leng quickly composed himself.
After all, he had seen many things in his life.

He said, “Alright, I’ll go with you, but let me see your IDs first.”

They showed their identification.

Then he said, “Okay, just let me make one phone call.”

“Sorry. No phone calls. Also, I should tell you, the evidence is solid. You’re not walking away from this.”

Across Tianhai, similar operations were unfolding in secret.

In just forty minutes, several of the Wang family’s key pawns were taken down.
It was so sudden and well-coordinated that they had no time to react.

Later…

A high-level video conference was underway.
Ten participants were present:

Five heads from first-class families, the First Elder of the Xiao family, one of the most powerful people of the Xiao family, three government officials, and one representative from the military.

The head of the Wang family wore an expression of anger and bitterness.
He glared at the others through the screen, his gaze especially sharp, almost venomous, when it landed on the head of the Hong family.

Then he spoke:
“So, why are you people doing this? Do you want to throw the entire situation into chaos?

I understand that you’re trying to increase your influence, but isn’t this a bit too hasty?”

Although his words sounded like those of a victim, there was a subtle note of threat in his voice.

Even if they were cornered, the Wang family could still stir up massive unrest in Tianhai, and no one wanted that.

There had to be a limit to the suppression.
And that limit had just been reached.

“So tell me,” he said, “What are your terms? What will it take for you to stop?”

All eyes turned to the head of the Hong family.

He calmly replied,
“The Tianhai Royal University district will now fall under the control of the Imperial Bull Gang.

As for the Wang investment's share, it can be returned, but only if you buy it back.

Also, you’re forbidden from entering into any future cooperation with Ning Corporation.”

The moment the Ning Corporation was mentioned, the First Elder of the Xiao family’s eyes narrowed sharply.

Interesting…
This condition was revealing.

The Hong family clearly didn’t have the capability to oppose the Ning family on their own. Someone powerful was behind them. But who? The Eastern Bank? Another hidden hand?

It was well known that someone had backed the Hong family’s sudden rise.

The other families had long been trying to trace this mysterious influence.
But until now, they had found nothing.

It seems it’s time to start taking the investigation more seriously.

The head of the Wang family closed his eyes, trying to suppress his growing anger.
Then, he turned to look at the government officials.

One of them spoke firmly,
“The individuals who have been apprehended, none of them are going free. We have solid evidence against each of them. Frankly, it’s astonishing they were allowed to operate so freely for so long.

You should all remember:
While there may be many powerful people and influential forces in Country X, no one is above the law.”

He did not say everything, nobody is above the law, but somebody can influence the creation of the law.

The Wang family head asked coldly,
“What about Wang Zhi?”

“He’s also made some mistakes,” the official replied.
“Nothing too severe, but the evidence is solid.
He will be punished, transferred to another province in the same rank.
His second-in-command will temporarily take over his duties.”

The Wang family head turned and glared at the Hong family head, his eyes burning with fury.

Everyone in the room knew, Wang Zhi’s second-in-command was from the Hong family. Although the Wang family head was aware of this, he was still enraged.

In fact, this was the Hong family’s main bargaining chip. They held serious blackmail material, and if they released it, Wang Zhi would be completely destroyed. It was a helpless move for them to send Wang Zhi far, and some government officials helped them save Wang Zhi.

In the end, the Wang family head said nothing.

The situation was unfolding too fast, too suddenly. Everything was confusing, chaotic.

For now, they needed to regroup, consolidate their strength, investigate the true cause behind the attacks, and search for a chance to retaliate.
They also had to reestablish contact with their allies.

The Wang family had been a dominant force in Tianhai for generations.
Its roots ran deep, and no one dared to ignore them.

That this kind of assault had succeeded at all was a testament to how carefully and powerfully it had been orchestrated.
Under normal circumstances, it would have been nearly impossible to suppress them.

Without offering any closing words or pleasantries, the Wang family head left the meeting in silence.

chapters.name: 24. Territory Claimed, Hearts Challenged
chapters.content:
At the same time…
The second-in-command of the Imperial Bull Gang, Hong Yun, stepped out of the gang's headquarters.
His mission: to take control of the newly conquered territory.
And he had to move fast.
It wasn't enough to win ground; they had to break the enemy’s spirit.

Soon after, Hong Yun and his men launched attacks on the nightclubs previously controlled by the Wang family.

Some of the Wang family’s lower-tier operatives had already caught wind of the attacks, but the news hadn’t spread widely.
The result: they were caught off guard and hit hard.

After a series of fierce battles and bloody skirmishes, all the establishments formerly under the Green Gang’s control fell into the hands of the Imperial Bull Gang.

But Hong Yun wasn’t focused on those victories.
His mind was fixed on one place.
Redrose Nightclub.
The place where Gu Jun was.

Redrose Nightclub

Ning Zhe and Zhou Hao were still fighting.
Though they were going all out, their movements were precise,  a controlled brawl between two skilled fighters.

Nearly every decoration in the club had been destroyed.
Parts of the ceiling had collapsed, and much of the floor was cracked or shattered.

Both men were covered in blood.
Ning Zhe’s left leg was twitching unnaturally, clearly damaged. Zhou Hao’s right arm was bent at an unnatural angle, broken.

They had fought barehanded the entire time. If weapons had been involved, the damage would have been far worse.

Suddenly, Ning Zhe stepped forward and threw a punch with his right fist.
Zhou Hao countered with an open palm.

Fist and palm collided.
A thunderous sound echoed through the club.

Both men were blasted backward, skidding across the floor at terrifying speed.

Blood trickled from Zhou Hao’s mouth.
Yet he wore a strange smile.

Everyone in the club watched in stunned silence.
Even Bai Xue and Rong Xi, both from prestigious noble families, were visibly shaken.

But the most helpless expressions belonged to Luo Yuxin and Zhao Ming.
They glanced at each other, completely lost.

The situation had escalated too quickly.
They were like rudderless ships in a violent storm, unable to decide what to do.

The only one who remained calm… was Gu Jun.
In fact, he looked like he was enjoying himself.

After some time, both Zhou Hao and Ning Zhe slowly stood up.
They were badly injured now, their bodies covered in bruises and blood.
They stared at each other, tension still crackling in the air.
Zhou Hao looked ready for another round, while Ning Zhe’s priority had shifted; he wanted to end the fight.

Suddenly, the sound of heavy footsteps echoed from outside the nightclub.
Everyone turned toward the entrance.
Shouts and fighting noises could be heard coming from outside.

Moments later, Hong Yun entered the club, followed by a group of men, all members of the Imperial Bull Gang.

At first, Hong Yun glanced around the chaotic scene with mild surprise.
Then his gaze slowly swept over the people present…
And finally landed on Gu Jun, where it paused for a few seconds.

Most people didn’t notice this subtle moment.
But those with sharp instincts, like Ning Zhe and Zhou Hao, caught it.

Then, Wang Hai stepped forward and glared at Hong Yun, demanding angrily,
“Hong Yun, what the hell are you doing here?”

Hong Yun smirked.
“Oh? I see… you haven’t heard the news. You might want to call your family. From now on, this nightclub belongs to the Imperial Bull Gang.”

“What the fuck are you talking about?”

“Don’t talk nonsense. Call your family.”

Wang Hai quickly pulled out his phone.
To his shock, there were several missed calls from his family.

He immediately called back.

After a brief conversation, he lowered the phone slowly.
His face was pale, stunned by what he had just heard.
How could this happen so quickly? So suddenly?
It took him a long moment to regain composure.

Then he looked up and said angrily,
“Fine, I understand the situation. But if it were a peaceful transfer, there wouldn’t be a problem. Why the hell did you attack the Green Gang’s people?”

Hong Yun shrugged casually.

“Oh, there’s a reason. It’s simple… I felt like it.”

“Fuck you! I’ll kill you!”

Hong Yun chuckled darkly.
“Heh. Do you really want to fight me now?”
“You should know, the entire Tianhai Royal University district is now under our control. Your people already left, and since the government issued no interference, even the police didn’t stop us from taking over.”
“If you fight now, you’ll get crushed, and no one will speak up for you. Honestly, I’d love to fight you in your current condition. Want proof?”

Then, without warning, he spat, right in Wang Hai’s face.
The saliva landed directly on target.

Wang Hai’s eyes blazed with fury.
He roared like a wild beast… but did nothing.

He truly didn’t know what to do.
If he didn’t fight back, he’d lose face, especially in front of Xiao Hao and Ning Zhe.
But if he did fight, the odds were against him.
And if he lost a leg or an arm… no one would step in to help him. His people had already retreated. He was alone.

He was caught in a painful dilemma.

At that moment, Xiao Hao looked over and asked,
“What’s going on?”

Wang Hai replied quietly,
“Something bad has happened. We’re being forced to leave this place.”

“But why?”

At that moment, Hong Yun stepped forward and spoke with a smirk.
“Because this is now our territory. And we don’t like your kind hanging around here.”

“Really?”
The voice that answered was cold.
“And if I decide to stay? Are you prepared to go against the Xiao family and the Ning family?”

Gu Jun clicked his tongue.
Smart move.
Bringing up the Ning family added weight, a clever way to shift the balance.

Then, Xiao Wei stepped in.
“Do you really think you can speak for the Xiao family?”

Xiao Hao responded with a sneer.
“Cousin, are you seriously standing against me and the Xiao family, for some outsider?”

Xiao Wei replied calmly,
“I’m not standing against the Xiao family. I’m standing against you.”

Hong Yun lost patience.
“Alright, enough with the talk. Now get the hell out.”

Suddenly, a new voice echoed through the club:
“Interesting… Someone in Tianhai actually dares to tell the heirs of both the Xiao and Ning families to ‘get the hell out.’ How bold.”

Everyone turned as a figure stepped inside.
It was none other than Xiao Rui.
The moment he heard about the situation, he left his father’s study and came directly.

Hong Yun opened his mouth to speak, but the moment he saw who it was, he choked on his words.
However, a heartbeat later, he forced himself to stay calm.
After all, Gu Jun was here.
He didn’t know Gu Jun’s full identity, but he did know that Gu Jun was someone even more dangerous than Xiao Rui.

Hong Yun bowed slightly and said,
“Apologies, Young Master Xiao. You understand that we have responsibilities. We respectfully request that your people leave this place.”

Xiao Rui chuckled coldly.
“Oh, we’ll leave, but when we leave is entirely up to us.
We have unfinished business here. Or are you planning to use force against us?”

The moment Xiao Rui finished speaking, a figure in a black robe stepped into the room.
Immediately afterward, a crushing pressure descended from above, filling the air.

It was a Peak Dark Level aura, which almost reached the semi-HuaJin, oppressive and suffocating.

Hong Yun, standing closest, took the brunt of it.
He nearly collapsed, his body trembling under the weight.
But he gritted his teeth and held firm.
With Gu Jun present, kneeling was not an option.

Xiao Rui narrowed his eyes and spoke slowly:
“You should never forget your place. Who gave you the courage to speak so rudely to the Xiao and Ning families?”
“Your backer? Then call him. I’d love to see if he’s strong enough to save you.”

Just when the situation was becoming more and more complicated, a new voice rang out.
It was sweet, yet carried a slightly cold undertone.

“What’s happening here?”

Suddenly, all the worry vanished from Bai Xue’s face. She cried out in relief,
“Sister! At last, you’re here!”

It was Bai Yue.

The expressions of both Xiao Rui and Ning Zhe lit up with excitement.
If anyone were to ask, "Who is the most desirable companion among noble families in Tianhai?"
The answer would likely be either Bai Yue or Xia Qingyue.

And now, Bai Yue had arrived.

All the stern authority Xiao Rui had shown against Hong Yun vanished in an instant.
He now stood as the picture of elegance, the classic, refined young master from a noble family.

Ning Zhe, on the other hand, didn’t rely on elegance. His charm came from raw manliness.
His body and face were already bloodied, which strangely added to his appeal.

He looked at Bai Yue coolly and said,
“Oh. Hello, Yue.”

Xiao Rui turned to Ning Zhe with raw hostility.
Ning Zhe returned the same look, a silent battle of pride and presence. It was a battle of taking the dominant position in front of Bai Yue.

Meanwhile, Gu Jun watched the unfolding scene with amusement.
He had just learned of Bai Yue’s identity, and it was indeed impressive.

She was the daughter of the second-in-command of the Shenfeng Sect.
In truth, Bai Yue’s mother was naw a very influential figure, with rumors swirling that she might become the next sect master once the current one advanced to the Innate Realm.
That would make her the leader of one of the Thirty-Three Great Influences.
And Bai Yue? She was her only daughter.

Bai Xue was her half-sister.

Gu Jun watched it all quietly, deep in thought. Then he muttered,
“So, Li Ming… Xiao Rui is the son of the rebel leader. The Ning family might be linked to my assassination. My mother has already arranged a fiancé for me. And we also need more influence in the Shenfeng Sect. How about we complicate things a little… and solve all four problems at once?”

Li Ming’s voice responded quietly,
“Your Highness… what exactly do you intend to do?”

Gu Jun smiled.
“Hmm. Just stand here and watch.”

At that moment, Xiao Rui and Ning Zhe were locked in a silent stare-down.
Bai Yue was thinking hard about how to mediate and resolve the situation peacefully.

Everyone around was hopeful, expecting diplomacy and calm.

Then, a new voice cut through the tension like a blade.

“Wife, you’re finally here? I’ve been waiting forever! I called you so many times. I was so scared! You’ll have to compensate me… with a long and wet kiss.”

A hand reached out and wrapped gently around Bai Yue’s slender waist.

The entire room froze.

Mouths opened. Eyes widened.

And then,
Rong Xi broke the silence first.

“…Fuck.”

Followed by Bai Xue.

“Fuck. Fuck.”

And finally, Xiao Wei, raising the stakes—

“Fuck. Fuck. Fuck.”

chapters.name: 25. Her Shield, His Game
chapters.content:
Xiao Rui and Ning Zhe both stared at Gu Jun, stunned.
Then they reacted at the same time.

“Who are you? How dare you touch her?”
“Let her go!”

Gu Jun replied with a smirk, “Oh? Seeing how intimate we are, shouldn't it be obvious what our relationship is? But since you two are a bit slow, I’ll spell it out for you: I’m her naughty fox, and she’s my little bunny.”

Xiao Rui and Ning Zhe nearly spat blood.

Gu Jun then noticed that Bai Yue was about to resist.
She was trying to break free, struggling to escape his grip on her waist.

Gu Jun quickly leaned in close to her ear and whispered,
“Listen, what I’m doing right now is for your own good. Don’t you get annoyed with all the people constantly trying to woo you? Think of me as a shield; this will keep them at bay. Blink twice if you agree. Actually, even if you disagree, you’ll have to go along with it. Otherwise, I’ll kiss you, right here, right now. A long, wet kiss. Trust me, I will. And your noble status won’t stop me.”

Bai Yue looked at Gu Jun, breathing hot and angry, with fire in her eyes.
She remembered the quiet, rural boy from the train.
How did he change so much in such a short time? How did he become such an ashole?

Although she was genuinely furious, to everyone else, it looked like a flirtatious stare.

Seeing that her fiery glare had no effect, she finally blinked twice, helplessly.
In her mind, she was now cursing all of Gu Jun’s ancestors.

“Don’t be so angry. I’ll explain everything to you later, okay?” he added playfully.

Gu Jun knew there were many Dark Stage warriors around who could overhear them, so he used a sound-isolation tool to block the conversation.

Almost everyone in the room was now glaring at Gu Jun with anger.
But Gu Jun only found amusement in the faces of Xiao Rui and Ning Zhe.

Why?
Because they desperately wanted to curse him with the vilest words possible, but couldn’t.
They had to maintain their image. If they lost their cool now, their chances with Bai Yue would vanish for good.

After a while, Bai Yue composed herself and turned toward Xiao Rui and Ning Zhe.
She spoke calmly,

“I’m taking everyone out of here. Any objections?”

Xiao Rui and Ning Zhe were still glaring at Gu Jun with vicious eyes as they bitterly said,
“Fine. No problem.”

After that, all the guests, including Xiao Rui and Ning Zhe, left the nightclub.

Once the place was almost empty, and only a few people remained outside, Bai Yue finally pulled herself out of Gu Jun’s grasp.
She turned to him and said coldly,
“I’m going home. And don’t forget, you owe me an explanation.”

It was nearly 10 PM.
Bai Yue was on her way home.

She didn’t actually live in the Bai family residence.
Not because of any issues with her father, she simply preferred living alone for privacy.

Tonight, Bai Xue and Rong Xi had also decided to stay with her at her private residence.

As their car neared the house, a vehicle suddenly emerged from the shadows and blocked their path.
Everyone in Bai Yue’s car grew tense. The bodyguards immediately prepared to act.

Moments later, a slender leg stepped out of the mysterious car, clad in sleek leather pants.
A woman walked straight toward Bai Yue’s vehicle.

Bai Yue’s bodyguards quickly got out and confronted her.
But the woman calmly said,
“I want to speak with Miss Bai.”

At that moment, the car windows rolled down.

The woman repeated,
“Miss Bai, someone wants to meet with you.”

Bai Yue said nothing.
But Rong Xi, hot-tempered as always, snapped,
“Why should Sister Bai go with you?”

In response, the woman removed her mask and sunglasses.

Bai Yue’s eyes narrowed slightly in surprise.
This woman was stunning, no less beautiful than Bai Yue herself.

Bai Yue responded firmly,
“You do realize it’s almost midnight, and I don’t even know who you are. Why would I go with you?”

The woman gave a calm smile.
“Miss Bai, come on now. You’re the daughter of the Bai family. More importantly, you’re the daughter of the second-in-command of the Shenfeng sect, and the granddaughter of a central leader.”

"You shouldn’t have much to fear in the whole of China. But if someone like you is afraid of a harmless girl like me, then I can only say… sorry."

Then she pulled out a badge.
"You should recognize this."

Bai Yue looked at the badge with a flicker of surprise.
She thought to herself,
“Who wants to see me at this hour? And why?”

The woman answered coolly,
“Sorry, that’s not for me to say. He will tell you himself.”

Bai Yue had no real hesitation.
She knew that badge well; it belonged to the Red Guards, elite central government agents tasked with protecting VIPs.
They only guarded people connected to national security.

Besides, Bai Yue had her own powerful Huajin-level tool for protection.

Still, although she wasn’t afraid, she did feel uncomfortable around this woman.
There was no killing intent, but there was a strange hostility, something cold beneath her beauty.

The woman then turned to the others.
"You two can go back. The person only wants to see Miss Bai. And Miss Bai, your bodyguards can come with you."

Bai Yue nodded.
"Bai Xue, Rong Xi, you two head back."

The woman added with a faint smile,
“Yes, I’ll return Miss Bai in one piece. You don’t need to worry.”

The two girls replied in unison,
“Alright, Sister, come back soon. Tonight was exciting, and the ending is… kinda weird.”

The woman in leather pants didn’t respond with words, just chuckled softly.

Then she gestured toward the darkened street.
Two more cars slowly emerged from the shadows.

Bai Yue’s eyes narrowed as she recognized one of them.
This car… she thought.
It was one of the highest-security vehicles in the country, built from a classified metal alloy used in top-tier fighter jets and submarines.
Her grandfather and mother had access to such a vehicle; even her father didn’t.

After Bai Yue and the leather-pants woman got in the car, the convoy began moving.
The last car was for Bai Yue’s bodyguards.

The journey was incredibly smooth.
With the Red Guards’ escort vehicle in front, all other traffic made way without delay. This sort of VIP treatment was rare, even for her.

Bai Yue tried to guess their destination from the direction of the roads.
She didn’t have to wait long; the trip was short.

And when they arrived… Bai Yue was surprised.

It wasn’t a hidden or secret location.
In fact, it was one of the most iconic landmarks in Tianhai, the tallest building in the city.

The headquarters of the Eastern Bank’s Tianhai branch.

Bai Yue pondered again,
“Who wants to see me? I don’t have any connection to the Eastern Bank…”

They entered the elevator.
It took nearly two minutes before it reached the top floor.

Bai Yue looked around.
It was clearly the highest floor, likely the chairman’s office or that of one of the top executives.
Through the glass walls, she could see the beautiful night view of the seductive, glowing Tianhai City.

The woman in leather pants walked ahead and opened a door, but it wasn’t an office.
It was a luxurious private suite.

“Alright, she’s here. Tell her whatever you want to say. I’ll wait outside.”

“Thank you, Di Yan.”

The only response from Di Yan was a light snort.

Then a familiar voice rang out:
“Hello, wife. We meet again.”

Yes, it was Gu Jun, sitting comfortably on the sofa, a wine glass in hand.

This time, Bai Yue was truly shocked.
So shocked that she couldn’t speak for a long while.

Her mind went back to the quiet village boy from the train, the one Rong Xi had half-jokingly accepted as a junior brother.

Now… if she still couldn’t see that Gu Jun was no ordinary person, then she didn’t deserve her reputation as the "academic bully" of Tianhai.

She finally asked,
“What’s your relationship with the Eastern Bank?”

Due to her status, she knew a bit about the Thirty-Three Great Influences.
And even among them, no one dared to provoke the Eastern Bank lightly.

Gu Jun didn’t answer directly.
Instead, he said,
“I told you I’d give you an explanation.”

“I’m listening.”

“From now on, you’ll be my girlfriend, at least in front of others.
Whether we become a real couple… well, that depends on the future.”

“Why do you think I would agree to that?”

“Because I believe you’re in a dangerous position right now.
Many powerful people are watching you, and most of them don’t have good intentions.
You might think your mother is secure in her position, but the truth is… she’s walking a fine line.
Her situation isn’t as stable as it seems.”

“What do you mean?”

“Although your mother is the top candidate to become the next Sect Master of the Shenfeng Sect, her biggest weakness is her cultivation level.
Even though she’s the most talented among the contenders, cultivation strength is a decisive factor.
And right now… she’s falling behind.”

“Also, your grandfather is in a difficult position right now. The Han family is eyeing him closely. If they get the chance, they’ll drag him down from his pedestal.

And then there's the Bai family. You know the Xiao family is becoming more and more aggressive in their attempt to control Tianhai City. They could strike at any time.”

“But do you know what the worst-case scenario is?
All your enemies are joining forces and attacking at once.
Although it may be almost impossible, if that happens… you could lose everything in a matter of hours.”

“Now, I can help you in this situation.
If you agree to act as my girlfriend, I promise the Eastern Bank will back you in all three situations.”

“I’ll also shield you from those annoying suitors who keep pestering you.”

chapters.name: 26. The Price of the Imperial Way
chapters.content:
“So, what do you think?”

Bai Yue wanted to reply, but as soon as she opened her mouth, Gu Jun stopped her.

“You know what, since we’re talking about relationships, I think I should explain why I chose you, and why I need a lover in the first place.”

Gu Jun paused, then added, “Actually, my mother is planning to set me up with a fiancée, and I’m not okay with that. So I need a lover, and in all of Tianhai, you’re the only one I know who can counter that woman.”

After saying this, Gu Jun stood up, poured a drink, and handed the glass to Bai Yue.

Bai Yue was now looking at him with laughter and amusement in her eyes.

“If you really agree to act with me, you have to be extremely careful. Whether it's my mother or my future fiancée, neither of them is an easy person to deal with. Your performance has to be flawless.”

Gu Jun took another pause and added, “By the way, my fiancée is one of the youngest innate-level warriors in all of Country X.”

Hearing this, Bai Yue almost spat out her drink.

Innate-level? That was the dream stage of every cultivator on Earth. Nobody, absolutely nobody in the whole earth dares to take an innate cultivator lightly; they were the real power holders behind the curtain, at the top of the food chain.

After some moments, she was finally able to compose herself. Although she was stunned, she felt a strange excitement in her heart.

“So why don’t you marry her? Are you afraid of her?”

“You don’t need to know that,” Gu Jun replied. “If you agree, I’ll instruct the Eastern Bank to help your mother, your grandfather, and the Bai family. I know you're very intelligent, but right now you’re powerless to help your relatives. I'm giving you this chance, and you’re not losing anything except a bit of mental peace. It’s a win-win deal. So, what do you think?”

Bai Yue fell silent for a full five minutes.
Then she said, “Okay. I agree.”

“Good.”

Then the door opened. A man in his fifties entered the room. Bai Yue recognized him immediately; he was a well-known figure in Tianhai, the president of the Tianhai Eastern Bank branch.

Gu Jun looked at him and said,
“From now on, you will take care of the Bai family. Manage their finances and ensure their security. This order remains in effect unless they do something that goes against morality.”

The president said nothing. He only nodded.

After some time, Bai Yue left for her home, and Di Yan followed her.

After that, only Gu Jun remained. He gave a subtle signal, and the hidden people around him quietly withdrew.

Now, Gu Jun was truly alone.

After a long pause, he began to speak.

“Do you think I’m showing weakness? Do you think I’m afraid of my mother just because she showed me goodwill?”

Suddenly, another presence appeared in the room. It was Xuanzhi.

He said,
“Maybe it is showing weakness, but that’s not necessarily a bad thing. Do you think having weaknesses is shameful? Let me ask you this: who doesn’t have weakness? Our dark warriors, our assassins? We created them to follow orders. They lack independent thought.

Throughout human history, every great emperor had their own weaknesses. Their journey was never easy. Having weaknesses and overcoming them is the Imperial Way.

You have several weaknesses. One of them is your mother. You have a complex relationship with her. You don’t want to get close to her, but you also don’t want to cut ties. You're caught in a dilemma. But if you can navigate through this, you’ll gain valuable insights. It will strengthen your resolve.

I won’t tell you what to do. You're still in the learning phase, not yet in true danger.”

He paused for a moment, then added:

“In fact, there are some powerful people who are concerned that your rise has been too smooth. If you can’t convince them, they won’t support you, and your future progress will face resistance. On the other hand, they don’t want to openly oppose the Imperial Way, so they’ve prepared some surprises for you.”

Xuanzhi then looked at Gu Jun deeply and said,

“You should know, your eighteenth year and seventy-first day is approaching. That marks the universal age of adulthood. At that time, your fate tribulation will begin, and you’ll lose most of your Dao protection. The surprises prepared by those people will also take effect. So be ready.”

For some reason, a chill crept up Gu Jun’s spine. He hadn’t felt such unease in a long time.

It took him a while to calm down. By then, Xuanzhi had already vanished.

After a few moments, someone entered the room. He appeared to be around thirty-five years old, energetic and striking, nearly six feet tall.

But most striking of all was his presence. His aura shifted like a blade in one moment and a calm sea the next.

The reason for this is that the person was standing on a threshold, the border between late-stage innate and peak innate level.

Gu Jun looked at him and said, “You should go into seclusion for the breakthrough.”

“Yes, Your Highness, I will soon. I just came because I haven’t seen you in a long time. So I thought, before closing up, I should visit you.”

“Okay.”

Gu Jun looked at him with a complicated expression.

This person was named Longtian. He was the First Elder of the Gu Empire. He also served as the head of the Planning Council, the Empire’s Finance Manager, and the controller of the Eastern Bank.

After a few moments, Gu Jun left. He didn’t say much to the people of the Eastern Bank, just one phrase:
“Take care.”

Now, Gu Jun was walking down a street at night. He was heading to the residence Uncle Tang had arranged for him, as the university dormitory was already closed. Truth be told, it was supposed to be his first night staying there, and he had wanted to sleep in the dorm, but things had come up.

Gu Jun looked up at the night sky. Then he glanced toward the Eastern Bank skyscraper and felt a rush of mixed emotions.

He knew very well that many things were beyond his control, and there were still many things he didn’t understand. There were likely old powerhouses, those fossils, who didn’t care about him, didn’t value him, or simply wanted to manipulate him. Some were likely within the solar system; others, perhaps, beyond it.

Thinking this, Gu Jun gave a soft chuckle.

“But they’ve made a mistake, or forgotten something. Maybe it’s because they’re too obsessed with so-called fate or divine mechanics. They’ve forgotten why I was chosen as heir to the throne.

Yes, I will grow by overcoming my weaknesses. But if anyone thinks they can manipulate me easily, they will soon learn what it truly means to walk the IMPERIAL WAY.”

Gu Jun was now hungry. Strangely, he didn’t have much money on him.

He soon saw a group of people sitting at a roadside noodle stall, most of them bikers, with a few security guards as well.

One of them called out to him,
“Hey, kid! Why are you walking around alone at this hour? You look like a decent college or university student. Are you hungry?”

Gu Jun replied,
“Yes, I’m hungry... but I don’t have much money.”

“OK, no problem. Come here, we’ll cover your bill.”

Gu Jun then learned that these bikers were from the military and currently on vacation, so they had come out together to enjoy themselves.

After eating, Gu Jun resumed walking. He was deep in thought, thinking about the writings of that great book:

AN EMPEROR CAN LAUGH,
AN EMPEROR CAN LOVE,
BUT
AN EMPEROR CANNOT TRUST,
BECAUSE THE STAKES ARE TOO HIGH,
AND

THE EMPEROR IS ALWAYS ALONE.

If any of you want to use me or try to manipulate my decisions, I will give you a great surprise one day.

Suddenly, Gu Jun felt a tingling sensation in his heart. He immediately looked up at the sky. The feeling seemed to be coming from above, or more precisely, from the full moon.

Gu Jun stared at the moon and muttered,
“Don’t worry. I’ll come for you soon.”

He then slowly made his way toward his house. His shadow stretched along the street, cast by the silver moonlight. Somewhere, music was playing, softly, mysteriously, but no one knew where it was coming from.

Meanwhile, Bai Yue had reached home.

Under the questioning eyes of Rong Xi and Bai Xue, she quietly entered her room.

She took out her secured satellite phone and made a call.

Truth be told, she didn’t have a good relationship with her father or mother. In the family, the only person she regularly spoke to was her grandfather, who lived in the capital.

Her grandfather picked up the phone.

“My sweet granddaughter, why are you calling at midnight? Aren’t you going to sleep?”

“Grandfather, I heard that the Han family is targeting you again.”

Her grandfather paused for a moment, then replied,
“Where did you hear that?”

Bai Yue then explained what had happened. She knew the matter needed to be kept secret, but she had to tell her grandfather to find out whether there was any risk involved or not.

Her grandfather replied,
“Eastern Bank, huh? You made the right decision. Also, do not try to investigate Gu Jun’s identity. Do you understand?”

“OK, Grandfather.”

chapters.name: 27. Crimson and the White
chapters.content:
Antarctica

Longyun and Code B were still fighting the underwater monster.

More and more sword slashes and stabs flowed through the water, accompanied by the monster's occasional attacks. This once peaceful underwater place was now filled with violence and murderous intent.

It was now increasingly clear that defeating the monster completely was impossible, especially since it had become far more mobile than before.

Longyun’s innate weapon kept breathing fire, but the results were underwhelming. There were some scars on the monster, but none of them were life-threatening.

Longyun realized that the monster still suffered from a lack of intellect, as though something was constantly suppressing its mind. Otherwise, it would have been unstoppable by now.

Longyun tried the previous tactic again, each of them attacking from opposite sides, but the effect was minimal.

He also began to notice that Code B was growing weaker, despite taking top-level pills. After all, it was an energy-consuming battle.

Longyun now understood that they wouldn't be able to defeat the monster without using that ultimate move. Fortunately, they now knew the creature’s weakness.

Thinking of this, Longyun felt a pang of sorrow. Code B had been his companion for a long time. But the mission was more important.

Then Longyun looked at Code B and began to communicate through divine sense. Hearing the command, Code B’s eyes turned cold and resolute.

He gathered all his remaining strength for the final push.

Longyun then took out nearly all his attacking tools and weapons, like his rod, and threw them toward Code B. After that, pain spread across his face. He was about to extract his innate core, an excruciatingly painful process. After some time, his face was full of fatigue, his eyes lost their luster, and it could be seen that he had become a lot weaker. And then a golden bead, glowing as brightly as the sun, appeared in Longyun’s hand. He gazed at it with a hint of nostalgia. He hadn’t wanted to take this step, but the array piece was too important.

Once everything was ready, Code B launched himself at the monster.

In his hands were all the tools, both his own and Longyun’s. As soon as the monster saw Code B rushing toward it, it instantly opened its massive jaws. Code B dove directly into its mouth. Just before it could close, Longyun threw his innate core. It followed Code B into the monster's mouth, just a moment behind him.

The monster shut its jaws, visibly satisfied. It then looked at Longyun with a provocative gaze, ready to digest Code B.

Inside its mostly transparent belly, Code B was now surrounded by the monster’s digestive fluids. Slowly, he swam toward the inner area, toward the monster’s weakness. Though he didn’t show it, Longyun knew he must be in immense pain; this creature’s digestive fluid was no joke.

Its weakness… yes, that heart-like organ that pulsed and contracted rhythmically. Code B was almost there. Longyun watched the scene with unwavering focus.

Just as Code B reached the target, he paused.

Longyun immediately became alert. He activated all his defensive mechanisms and, taking advantage of the moment, retrieved the array piece into his space ring.

After a brief pause, Code B’s face filled with determination and fanaticism. He then opened his eyes wide and looked around, as if it were the last time he’d see the world.

After that, he muttered something. Though Longyun couldn’t hear the words, he understood them:

“Humanity shall prevail. The Gu Empire will live forever.”

Then Code B ignited his weapon.

At the same moment, Longyun snapped his fingers, signaling his innate core to activate.

Then… Bang.

A massive explosion followed.

It was as if the earth itself had collapsed.

The blast was so powerful that neither the underwater array nor the monster’s incredibly durable innate body could withstand it.

Nearly everything within a one cubic kilometer radius was obliterated. Water and ice were vaporized in an instant.

Even with Longyun’s powerful defensive tools and his formidable innate body, he couldn’t fully protect himself. The shockwave left him nearly unconscious.

Though he was an innate-level warrior, he had lost his core, and the force unleashed in the explosion was extraordinary. Several powerful tools and the innate core had been used simultaneously.

And so, it happened. He was now completely crushed.

On the icy surface, Code Z sensed everything.

Then he saw the huge mushroom cloud in the sky. Although he was not harmed severely, he was visibly shaken.

For a long time, he had received no information from either Longyun or Code B. Now, since the influence of he underwater array was gone, he could sense Longyun, but not Code B.
